name: 邱弘緯
objective:
Course Description: 
	This course offers an in-depth exploration into patent analytics. Participants will traverse topics such as research methodologies specific to patents, foundational aspects of patent law, the pivotal role of semiconductors in patenting, keyword-centric patent searches complemented by pertinent case studies, the integration of linguistics and logic in understanding patents, the practical applications of ChatGPT, and the utility of Natural Language Processing in patent data analysis.

Course Topics:
1.	Research Methodology in Patent Analytics:
	•	Overview of innovation trends
	•	Analyzing McKinsey and Gartner reports for patent insights
2.	Basics of Patent Law:
	•	Intellectual Property: Understanding the Basics
	•	What makes an invention patentable?
	•	Constructing and analyzing a patent claim
	•	Understanding patent structures
	•	The thin line between innovation and non-obviousness
	•	Crafting an effective patent strategy
3.	Semiconductors and Their Importance in Patenting:
	•	Introduction to semiconductor processes, manufacturing, and devices
	•	Deep dive into VLSI design, IP, MCU, CPU, GPU, firmware, OS, and software
	•	A look at solid-state devices
	•	Advanced Process Technologies (Refer to Advanced-Process-Technologies.pdf for detailed insights)
4.	Keyword-driven Patent Search & Case Studies:
	•	Patent cases on advanced devices: Planar FET, FinFET, GAA
	•	Patent cases involving AI methodologies
5.	Language, Logic, and Meaning in Patent Analysis:
	•	Introduction to linguistics in patent analysis (Reference: https://chowkafat.net/Lingtopic.html)
	•	Basics of semantics and its importance in patent comprehension
	•	Deep dive into formal semantics and generalized quantifier theory
	•	Deciphering the logical form and structure in patents
	•	Introduction to propositional logic and its application in patent analysis
	•	Unraveling predicate logic in patent contexts
6.	Practical Applications using ChatGPT:
	•	Using ChatGPT for instructional language and problem-solving in patent analytics
	•	Case study: Constructing a GAA using ChatGPT
	•	ChatGPT in research methodologies and patent search
7.	Natural Language Processing (NLP) in Patent Analysis:
	•	Understanding word embedding and word vectors
	•	Techniques for determining similarity in patent documents using NLP
schedule:
